sen.j: 本因坊 秀栄（ほんいんぼう しゅうえい、嘉永5年9月20日 (旧暦)（1852年11月1日） - 明治40年（1907年）2月10日）は江戸時代・明治の囲碁棋士 (囲碁)、十三世林秀栄、十七世、十九世本因坊、名人 (囲碁)。
sen.e: Honinbo Shuei (November 1, 1852 - February 10, 1907) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory) player in the Edo and Meiji periods, also known as Shuei HAYASHI the thirteenth, Honinbo the seventeenth and the nineteenth, and the Igo Master.

Honinbo Shuei (November 1, 1852 - February 10, 1907) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory) player in the Edo and Meiji periods, also known as Shuei HAYASHI the 13th, Honinbo the 17th and the 19th, and a Meijin (master)(Igo).
sen.cmt: thirteenth→13th,seventeenth→17th,nineteenth→19th と修正しました。the Igo Master→a Meijin (master) と修正しました。（名人は囲碁の世界のタイトルであるのであえて補いました）
sen.e: Honinbo Shuei (November 1, 1852 - February 10, 1907) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory) player in the Edo and Meiji periods, also known as Shuei HAYASHI the 13th, Honinbo the 17th and the 19th, and a Meijin (master)(Igo).

sen.j: 生国は江戸。
sen.e: His home province was Edo.
His home province was Edo.
His home province was Edo.

sen.j: 法名は日達。
sen.e: His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Nichidatsu.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Nichidatsu.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Nichidatsu.

sen.j: 本因坊秀和の次男で、本名は土屋平次郎。
sen.e: He was the second son of Honinbo Shuwa and his real name was Hirajiro TSUCHINOYA.
He was the second son of Honinbo Shuwa and his real name was Hirajiro TSUCHINOYA.
He was the second son of Honinbo Shuwa and his real name was Hirajiro TSUCHINOYA.

sen.j: 林家 (囲碁)十三世を継ぐが、方円社に対抗するため本因坊家に復帰、五段で十七世を継ぎ、林家を絶家とした。
sen.e: He succeeded the Hayashike (Igo) the thirteenth, but returned to the Honinbo family to oppose to Hoensha, succeeded Honinbo the seventeenth in the fifth dan (qualification of rank) level and extinguished the Hayashike.

He succeeded the Hayashi family (Igo) the 13th, but returned to the Honinbo family to oppose to Hoensha, succeeded Honinbo the 17th in the 5th dan (qualification of rank) level and extinguished the Hayashi family.

He succeeded the Hayashi family (Igo) the 13th, but returned to the Honinbo family to oppose to Hoensha, succeeded Honinbo the 17th in the 5th dan (qualification of rank) level and extinguished the Hayashi family.

sen.j: 明治後半において名人中の名人と謳われ、その平明な棋風は現代でも高く評価される。
sen.e: He was praised as the Master of the masters in the second half of the Meiji period and his transpicuous Igo style is highly evaluated even in the present age.
He was praised as the Master of the masters in the second half of the Meiji period and his transpicuous Igo style is highly evaluated even in the present age.
He was praised as the Master of the masters in the second half of the Meiji period and his transpicuous Igo style is highly evaluated even in the present age.

sen.j: 2008年囲碁殿堂入り。
sen.e: He was admitted to the Igo Hall of Fame in 2008.
He was admitted to the Igo Hall of Fame in 2008.
He was admitted to the Igo Hall of Fame in 2008.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 本因坊就位まで
sen.e: Until holding the title of Honinbo
Until holding the title of Honinbo
Until holding the title of Honinbo

sen.j: 江戸本所相生町の本因坊邸に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in the Honinbo residence at Honjoaioi-cho in Edo.
He was born in the Honinbo residence at Honjoaioi-cho in Edo.
He was born in the Honinbo residence at Honjoaioi-cho in Edo.

sen.j: 1862年(文久2年)、11歳で十二世林柏栄門入の養子となり、林秀栄と改名。
sen.e: In 1862, he was adopted by Hakueimonnyu HAYASHI the twelfth and changed the name to Shuei HAYASHI at the age of eleven.
In 1862, he was adopted by Hakueimonnyu HAYASHI the 12th, and changed the name to Shuei HAYASHI at the age of 11.
sen.cmt: twelfth→12th,eleven と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: In 1862, he was adopted by Hakueimonnyu HAYASHI the 12th, and changed the name to Shuei HAYASHI at the age of 11.

sen.j: 12歳で初段。
sen.e: He achieved the first dan level when he was twelve years old.
He achieved the 1st dan level when he was 12 years old.
sen.cmt: first→1st,twelve→12 と修正しました。（用語統一・その他・３１項に従い）
sen.e: He achieved the 1st dan level when he was 12 years old.

sen.j: 1864年(元治元年)柏栄死去し、その死を伏せたままで翌1865年に家督願いを出し、1867年(慶応3年)に16歳三段で家督を許されて、林家十三世となる。
sen.e: Hakuei died in 1864, but Shuei kept his death secret and submitted a request to inherit the family estate in the following 1865, then the family estate was allowed to him in the third dan level at the age of sixteen in 1867, and thereby he became Hayashike the thirteenth.

Hakuei died in 1864, but Shuei kept his death secret and submitted a request to inherit the family estate in the following 1865, then the family estate was allowed to him in the 3rd dan level at the age of 16 in 1867, and thereby he became the 13th of Hayashi family.
sen.cmt: third dan→3rd dan,sixteen→16,Hayashike→Hatashi family,thirteenth→13th と修正しました。
sen.e: Hakuei died in 1864, but Shuei kept his death secret and submitted a request to inherit the family estate in the following 1865, then the family estate was allowed to him in the 3rd dan level at the age of 16 in 1867, and thereby he became the 13th of Hayashi family.

sen.j: 1868年(明治元年)17歳の時に本因坊、安井家の同意で四段昇段を求めたが、井上松本因碩がこれに反対し、争碁の相手として門人の小林鉄次郎を指名した。
sen.e: In 1868, Shuei asked for a promotion to the fourth dan level at the age of seventeen with the consent of Honinbo and the Yasui family, but Matsumotoinseki INOUE opposed this and designated Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI, his disciple, as the opponent of Sogo (official challenge match).

In 1868, Shuei asked for a promotion to the 4th dan level at the age of 17 with the consent of Honinbo and the Yasui family, but Matsumotoinseki INOUE opposed this and designated Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI, his disciple, as the opponent of Sogo (official challenge match).

In 1868, Shuei asked for a promotion to the 4th dan level at the age of 17 with the consent of Honinbo and the Yasui family, but Matsumotoinseki INOUE opposed this and designated Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI, his disciple, as the opponent of Sogo (official challenge match).

sen.j: 秀栄は林家当主として因碩との対戦を求めたが応じなかったため、三家にて秀栄の四段を認め、またかねてから同種の問題を起こしていた因碩には昇段の同意を求めないこととなった。
sen.e: Shuei demanded to match up with Inseki as the family head of the Hayashike, but was rejected, and therefore three families approved the fourth dan level to Shuei and also decided not to ask the consent on the dan promotion to Inseki who had previously caused similar problems.

Shuei demanded to match up with Inseki as the family head of the Hayashike, but was rejected, and therefore three families approved the fourth dan level to Shuei and also decided not to ask the consent on the dan promotion to Inseki who had previously caused similar problems.

Shuei demanded to match up with Inseki as the family head of the Hayashike, but was rejected, and therefore three families approved the fourth dan level to Shuei and also decided not to ask the consent on the dan promotion to Inseki who had previously caused similar problems.

sen.j: 1869年(明治2年)、本因坊秀悦、中川亀三郎らと研究会「六人会」を発足。
sen.e: In 1869, he inaugurated a study group 'Rokuninkai' (six-people society) with Honinbo Shuetsu, Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, and others
In 1869, he inaugurated a study group 'Rokuninkai' (six-people society) with Honinbo Shuetsu, Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, and others.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: In 1869, he inaugurated a study group 'Rokuninkai' (six-people society) with Honinbo Shuetsu, Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, and others.

sen.j: 1870年(明治3年)伊藤松和七段と十番碁を打ち（秀栄先）、7勝2敗1ジゴ。
sen.e: In 1870, he played with Showa ITO the seventh dan level (Shuei, Sen [playing first in all three matches]), seven wins, two losses, and one draw.
In 1870, he played Jubango (10 game match) against Showa ITO the 7th dan level (Shuei, Sen [playing 1st in all 3 matches]), 7 wins, 2 losses, and 1 draw.
sen.cmt: 「十番碁」を補いました。 with→against, seventh→7th, first→1,three→3,seven→7, two→2, one→1 と修正しました。（「用語統一・その他・３１項」に従い）
sen.e: In 1870, he played Jubango (10 game match) against Showa ITO the 7th dan level (Shuei, Sen [playing 1st in all 3 matches]), 7 wins, 2 losses, and 1 draw.

sen.j: 20歳で五段。
sen.e: He achieved the fifth dan level when he was twenty years old.
He achieved the 5th dan level when he was 20 years old.
He achieved the 5th dan level when he was 20 years old.

sen.j: 翌1872年(明治5年)から24歳まで、本因坊家とは疎遠になっていた本因坊秀甫とともに美濃国、尾張国、伊勢国、京阪を遊歴。
sen.e: From 1872 until he was twenty-four years old, Shuei toured the Mino, Owari, and Ise provinces and the Keihan (Kyoto and Osaka) area with Honinbo Shuho who had been alienated from the Honinbo family.
From 1872 until he became 24 years old, Shuei toured the Mino, Owari, and Ise Provinces and the Keihan (Kyoto and Osaka) area with Honinbo Shuho who had been alienated from the Honinbo family.
From 1872 until he became 24 years old, Shuei toured the Mino, Owari, and Ise Provinces and the Keihan (Kyoto and Osaka) area with Honinbo Shuho who had been alienated from the Honinbo family.

sen.j: 1876年(明治9年)、中川亀三郎と十番碁、小林鉄次郎と二十番碁、藤田方策と十番碁を打ち、小林には定先に打ち込む。
sen.e: In 1876, he played ten matches with Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, twenty matches with Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI, and ten matches with Hosaku FUJITA, in which he performed Josen (the same as sen above) to Kobayashi.

In 1876, he played 10 matches against Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, 20 matches against Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI, and 10 matches against Hosaku FUJITA, in which he performed Josen (the same as sen above) to Kobayashi.

In 1876, he played 10 matches against Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, 20 matches against Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI, and 10 matches against Hosaku FUJITA, in which he performed Josen (the same as sen above) to Kobayashi.

sen.j: この頃、秀栄は養母と折り合いが悪く、別居を強いられていた。
sen.e: Around this time, Shuei did not go well with his foster mother and was forced to live separately.
Around this time, Shuei was not going well with his foster mother, and had been forced to live separately.
sen.cmt: did not go→was not going,was→had been と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Around this time, Shuei was not going well with his foster mother, and had been forced to live separately.

sen.j: 1877年(明治10年)養母が亡くなると、親戚の者が家名を継ぐこととなり、秀栄は碁家としての林家を存続を担う。
sen.e: In 1877, his foster mother died and a relative succeeded the family name, and thereby, Shuei began to bear the continuance of the Hayashike as Igo family.
In 1877, his foster mother died and a relative succeeded the family name, and thereby, Shuei began to bear the continuance of the Hayashi family as an Igo family.
sen.cmt: Hayashike→Hayashi family と修正しました。an を補いました。
sen.e: In 1877, his foster mother died and a relative succeeded the family name, and thereby, Shuei began to bear the continuance of the Hayashi family as an Igo family.

sen.j: 1879年(明治12年)、当時の棋界の第一人者だった村瀬秀甫七段と中川亀三郎六段が中心となり、方円社が囲碁研究会として発会される。
sen.e: In 1879, Hoensha was inaugurated as Igo study group mainly by Shuho MURASE the seventh dan level and Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA who were the leading authority of the Igo world at that time.
In 1879, Hoensha was inaugurated as an Igo study group mainly by Shuho MURASE the seventh dan level and Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, who were the leading authority of the Igo world at that time.
sen.cmt: an, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: In 1879, Hoensha was inaugurated as an Igo study group mainly by Shuho MURASE the seventh dan level and Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA, who were the leading authority of the Igo world at that time.

sen.j: これを記念した方円社発会記念対局に、秀栄も安井算英五段などの家元側の棋士とともに参加した。
sen.e: In commemoration of this, Shuei participated in the Hoensha opening commemoration match with the Igo players in the side of the head family including Sanei YASUI.
In commemoration of this, Shuei participated in the Hoensha opening commemoration match with the Igo players of the head family side including Sanei YASUI, the fifth dan level.
sen.cmt: 「五段」を補いました。in→of,side of the head family→head family side と修正しました。
sen.e: In commemoration of this, Shuei participated in the Hoensha opening commemoration match with the Igo players of the head family side including Sanei YASUI, the fifth dan level.

sen.j: しかしほどなくして、家元の権威を認めない方円社のやり方に、秀栄らは強く反発し方円社を脱会、方円社と村瀬秀甫に対抗するようになった。
sen.e: Soon after that, however, Shuei began to act repulsively against Hoensha's way not appreciating the authority in the head family and withdrew from Hoensha to counteract Hoensha and Shuho MURASE.
Soon after that, however, Shuei began to act repulsively against Hoensha's way not appreciating the authority of the head family, and withdrew from Hoensha to counteract Hoensha and Shuho MURASE.
sen.cmt: in→of と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Soon after that, however, Shuei began to act repulsively against Hoensha's way not appreciating the authority of the head family, and withdrew from Hoensha to counteract Hoensha and Shuho MURASE.

sen.j: 9月下旬、秀栄は、十六世本因坊秀元、井上因碩らと謀り、方円社の社員となっていた門下の段位を剥奪し、対立は決定的になった。
sen.e: Near the end of September, Shuei deprived the dan levels of the disciples who became the employees of Hoensha by conspiring with Honinbo Shugen the sixteenth and Inseki INOUE, which made the confrontation decisive.

In the end of September, Shuei deprived the dan levels of the disciples who became the employees of Hoensha by conspiring with Honinbo Shugen the 16th and Inseki INOUE, which made the confrontation decisive.

In the end of September, Shuei deprived the dan levels of the disciples who became the employees of Hoensha by conspiring with Honinbo Shugen the 16th and Inseki INOUE, which made the confrontation decisive.

sen.j: 1884年(明治17年)、林家を廃絶し、本因坊秀元を隠居させて本因坊家に復帰し、十七世本因坊秀栄を名乗る。
sen.e: In 1884, Shuei abolished the Hayashiyake and forced Honinbo Shugen retire, then returned to the Honinbo family and called himself Honinbo Shuei the seventeenth.
In 1884, Shuei abolished the Hayashi family and forced Honinbo Shugen retire, then returned to the Honinbo family and called himself Honinbo Shuei the 17th.
sen.cmt: Hayashike→Hayashi family,seventeenth→17th と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1884, Shuei abolished the Hayashi family and forced Honinbo Shugen retire, then returned to the Honinbo family and called himself Honinbo Shuei the 17th.

sen.j: 井上馨、金玉均らの勧めで後藤象二郎に方円社と仲介を依頼、12月21日、村瀬秀甫と秀栄先での十番碁を開始。
sen.e: He asked Shojiro GOTO to act as intermediary for reconciliation with Hoensha recommended by Kaoru INOUE and Gyokukin KIN, etc. and on December 21, Shuei started ten matches with Shuho MURASE, in Shuei's sen.

He asked Shojiro GOTO to act as intermediary for the reconciliation with Hoensha recommended by Kaoru INOUE and Gyokukin KIN and others, then on December 21, Shuei started 10 matches with Shuho MURASE, in Shuei's sen.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。etc.→and others,and→then,ten→10 と修正しました。
sen.e: He asked Shojiro GOTO to act as intermediary for the reconciliation with Hoensha recommended by Kaoru INOUE and Gyokukin KIN and others, then on December 21, Shuei started 10 matches with Shuho MURASE, in Shuei's sen.

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年）、7月30日、方円社と和解して、本因坊秀甫の八段を正式に認め、同時に本因坊を秀甫に譲って、自らは土屋秀栄を名乗る。
sen.e: In July 30, 1886, Shuei reconciled with Hoensha and officially approved the eighth dan level to Honinbo Shuho, and at the same time he transferred the title of Honinbo to Shuho and called himself Shuei TSUCHIYA.

In July 30, 1886, Shuei reconciled with Hoensha and officially approved the eighth dan level to Honinbo Shuho, and at the same time he transferred the title of Honinbo to Shuho and called himself Shuei TSUCHIYA.

In July 30, 1886, Shuei reconciled with Hoensha and officially approved the eighth dan level to Honinbo Shuho, and at the same time he transferred the title of Honinbo to Shuho and called himself Shuei TSUCHIYA.

sen.j: 秀甫は、十八世本因坊となり、即日に五段だった秀栄に七段を贈る。
sen.e: Shuho became Honinbo the eighteenth and immediately on the same day presented the seventh dan level to Shuei who had the fifth dan level.
Shuho became Honinbo the 18th, and immediately on the same day, he presented the 7th dan level to Shuei who had the 5th dan level.
sen.cmt: eighteenth→18th,seventh→7th,fifth→5th と修正しました。he, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Shuho became Honinbo the 18th, and immediately on the same day, he presented the 7th dan level to Shuei who had the 5th dan level.

sen.j: 8月6日、秀甫との十番碁は5勝5敗の打ち分けで終わる。
sen.e: On August 6, Shuei finished ten matches with Shoho in a draw, with five wins and five losses.
On August 6, Shuei finished 10 matches against Shoho in a draw, with 5 wins and 5 losses.
On August 6, Shuei finished 10 matches against Shoho in a draw, with 5 wins and 5 losses.

sen.j: しかし直後の10月14日に秀甫が没し、秀栄は中川亀三郎に本因坊位継承のための争碁を申し込むが断られ、再び本因坊家を継いで十九世本因坊となる。
sen.e: Not long after that, however, Shuho died on October 14 and Shuei asked Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA for Sogo (official challenge match) to succeed the title of Honinbo but was declined, and therefore Shuei succeeded the Honinbo family again to be Honinbo the nineteenth.

Immediately after that, however, Shuho died on October 14, and Shuei asked Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA for Sogo (official challenge match) to succeed the title of Honinbo but was declined, and therefore Shuei succeeded the Honinbo family again to be Honinbo the 19th.
sen.cmt: Not long→Immediately, nineteenth→19th と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Immediately after that, however, Shuho died on October 14, and Shuei asked Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA for Sogo (official challenge match) to succeed the title of Honinbo but was declined, and therefore Shuei succeeded the Honinbo family again to be Honinbo the 19th.

sen.j: これ以後本因坊門と方円社は分離する。
sen.e: After this, Honinbomon and Hoensha split off.
After this, Honinbomon and Hoensha split off.
After this, Honinbomon and Hoensha split off.

sen.j: 名人への道
sen.e: The road to the Master
The road to a Meijin (master)
sen.cmt: the→a,Master→Meijin (master) と修正しました。（囲碁の世界でのタイトルであり、頻出単語でもあるのでここに補いました）
sen.e: The road to a Meijin (master)

sen.j: 1892年（明治25年）、「囲碁奨励会（日本橋倶楽部奨励会）」を発足。
sen.e: He inaugurated 'Igo Shorei Kai (Nihonbashi Club Shorei Kai)' (encouragement society) in 1892.
He inaugurated 'Igo Shorei Kai' (Nihonbashi Club Shorei Kai) (encouragement society) in 1892.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: He inaugurated 'Igo Shorei Kai' (Nihonbashi Club Shorei Kai) (encouragement society) in 1892.

sen.j: 後に方円社を除名されていた本因坊秀哉が入門するなどし、1894年まで続いた。
sen.e: Later Honinbo Shuya who had been expelled from Hoensha became a disciple, and this Shorei Kai lasted until 1894.
Later Honinbo Shuya who had been expelled from Hoensha became a disciple, and this Shorei Kai lasted until 1894.
Later Honinbo Shuya who had been expelled from Hoensha became a disciple, and this Shorei Kai lasted until 1894.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）、「四象会」発足。
sen.e: In 1895, he inaugurated 'Shishokai'.
In 1895, he inaugurated 'Shishokai.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1895, he inaugurated 'Shishokai.'

sen.j: 当時の資産家であった高田慎蔵、及びその夫人民子の支援を受ける。
sen.e: He was supported by Shinzo TAKADA who was very wealthy at that time and also by Tamiko, Shinzo's wife.
He was supported by Shinzo TAKADA who was a wealthy person at that time and also by Tamiko, Shinzo's wife.
sen.cmt: was very wealthy→was a wealthy person と修正しました。
sen.e: He was supported by Shinzo TAKADA who was a wealthy person at that time and also by Tamiko, Shinzo's wife.

sen.j: 進境著しい秀栄の元には土屋秀元などの他、雁金準一を始め方円社の若手棋士もこぞって参加した。
sen.e: Shugen TSUCHIYA as well as young Igo players of Hoensha including Junichi KARIGANE gathered one after another at Shuei who made remarkable progress.
Shugen TSUCHIYA, as well as young Igo players of Hoensha including Junichi KARIGANE, gathered one after another at Shuei who made remarkable progress.
Shugen TSUCHIYA, as well as young Igo players of Hoensha including Junichi KARIGANE, gathered one after another at Shuei who made remarkable progress.

sen.j: 毎月湯島の秀栄宅で計102回、1904年まで続く。
sen.e: This continued at the residence of Shuei in Yushima every month until 1904, totally one hundred and two times.
This continued at the residence of Shuei in Yushima every month until 1904, totally 102 times.
sen.cmt: one hundred and two→102 と修正しました。
sen.e: This continued at the residence of Shuei in Yushima every month until 1904, totally 102 times.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）八段に進む。
sen.e: He achieved the eighth dan level in 1898.
He achieved the eighth dan level in 1898.
He achieved the eighth dan level in 1898.

sen.j: 1904年(明治37年)、四象会が終了し、時事新報の矢野由次郎の斡旋で「日本囲棋会」の設立が進められ、その設立準備会記念碁として秀栄と田村保寿（先）の二番碁が行われて秀栄が2連勝、これが秀栄最後の勝負碁となった。
sen.e: In 1904, Shishokai ended and the establishment of 'Nihon Igo Kai' (Japan Igo Association) was promoted by the intercession of Yoshijiro YANO at Jiji Shinpo (a daily newspaper publishing company), and in commemoration of preparation of the establishment, Shuei fought with Yasuhisa TAMURA (Sen) in two matches and won both, which was his last Igo match.

In 1904, Shishokai ended and the establishment of 'Nihon Igo Kai' (Japan Igo Association) was promoted by the intercession of Yoshijiro YANO at Jiji Shinpo (a daily newspaper publishing company), and in commemoration of the preparation of its establishment, Shuei fought against Yasuhisa TAMURA (Sen) in two matches and won both, which was his last Igo match.
sen.cmt: preparation of the establishment→the preparation of its establishment,with→against と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1904, Shishokai ended and the establishment of 'Nihon Igo Kai' (Japan Igo Association) was promoted by the intercession of Yoshijiro YANO at Jiji Shinpo (a daily newspaper publishing company), and in commemoration of the preparation of its establishment, Shuei fought against Yasuhisa TAMURA (Sen) in two matches and won both, which was his last Igo match.

sen.j: 日本囲棋会は翌1905年に設立され、名誉会員には福沢捨次郎、犬養毅、渋沢栄一、岩崎久弥、豊川良平、高田民子らがいた。
sen.e: The Nihon Igo Kai was established in the following 1905 including honorary members such as Sutejiro FUKUZAWA, Tsuyoshi INUKAI, Eichi SHIBUSAWA, Hisaya Iwasaki, Ryohei TOYOKAWA, and Tamiko Takada.
The Nihon Igo Kai was established in the following 1905, including honorary members such as Sutejiro FUKUZAWA, Tsuyoshi INUKAI, Eichi SHIBUSAWA, Hisaya IWASAKI, Ryohei TOYOKAWA, and Tamiko TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。Iwasaki→IWASAKI,Takeda→TAKEDA と修正しました。
sen.e: The Nihon Igo Kai was established in the following 1905, including honorary members such as Sutejiro FUKUZAWA, Tsuyoshi INUKAI, Eichi SHIBUSAWA, Hisaya IWASAKI, Ryohei TOYOKAWA, and Tamiko TAKEDA.

sen.j: （秀栄の死後に解散）
sen.e: (The Nihon Igo Kai was dissolved after the death of Shuei.)
(The Nihon Igo Kai was dissolved after the death of Shuei.)
(The Nihon Igo Kai was dissolved after the death of Shuei.)

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）、田村が定先を保っていた以外、他の棋士を先二以下に打ち込み、推されて九段昇段、名人就位。
sen.e: In 1906, other than when Tamura kept Josen, Shuei beat other Igo players under Sen ni (handicap matches) and was promoted to the ninth dan level and also appointed to the Master.
In 1906, other than when Tamura kept Josen, Shuei beat other Igo players under Sen ni (handicap matches), and was promoted to the ninth dan level and also appointed to the Master.
In 1906, other than when Tamura kept Josen, Shuei beat other Igo players under Sen ni (handicap matches), and was promoted to the ninth dan level and also appointed to the Master.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）、前年12月から流行感冒に伏せ、2月10日享年56で没す。
sen.e: He was confined to bed due to influenza since December 1907 and died at the age of fifty-six in February 10, 1907.
He was confined to bed due to influenza from December of the preceding year, and died at the age of 56 in February 10, 1907.
sen.cmt: since→from,December 1907→December of the preceding year （前年12月）,fifty-six→56 と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: He was confined to bed due to influenza from December of the preceding year, and died at the age of 56 in February 10, 1907.

sen.j: 法名日達、本郷丸山本妙寺に葬られる。
sen.e: He was buried at the Honmyo-ji Temple in Hongo Maruyama and his homyo was Nichidatsu.
He was buried at the Honmyo-ji Temple in Hongo Maruyama, and his homyo was Nichidatsu.
He was buried at the Honmyo-ji Temple in Hongo Maruyama, and his homyo was Nichidatsu.

sen.j: 秀栄門下の最強者は秀哉であったが、秀栄は金銭に汚いなどの理由で秀哉を嫌っており、雁金準一を後継者に立てる意向があったといわれる。
sen.e: Shuya was the strongest player among Shuei's disciples, but it is said that Shuei disliked Shuya due to his meanness about money and intended to put up Junichi KARIGANE as his successor.
Shuya was the strongest player among Shuei's disciples, but it is said that Shuei disliked Shuya due to his miserly attitude, and intended to put up Junichi KARIGANE as his successor.
sen.cmt: meanness about money→miserly attitude と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Shuya was the strongest player among Shuei's disciples, but it is said that Shuei disliked Shuya due to his miserly attitude, and intended to put up Junichi KARIGANE as his successor.

sen.j: しかし秀栄は後継者を指名することなく死去し、本因坊位をめぐって混乱が起きた。
sen.e: However, Shuei died before appointing his successor and the confusion occurred over the status of Honinbo.
However, Shuei died before appointing his successor, so the confusion occurred over the status of Honinbo.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。and→so と修正しました。
sen.e: However, Shuei died before appointing his successor, so the confusion occurred over the status of Honinbo.

sen.j: 結局弟の秀元がいったん二十世を継ぎ、一年後に秀哉に譲る形で事態を収拾している。
sen.e: After all, it was sorted out by Shugen, Shuei's younger brother, who succeeded the twentieth for the time being and transferred it to Shuya one year later.
After all, it was sorted out by Shugen, Shuei's younger brother, who succeeded the 20th for the time being and transferred it to Shuya one year later.
After all, it was sorted out by Shugen, Shuei's younger brother, who succeeded the 20th for the time being and transferred it to Shuya one year later.

sen.j: 主な戦績
sen.e: Main victories
Main results
Main results

sen.j: 十番碁
sen.e: Ten matches
Ten matches
Ten matches

sen.j: 1870年 伊藤松和十番碁（秀栄先）7-2-1
sen.e: 1870 Ten matches with Showa ITO (Shuei, Sen), 7-2-1
1870: 10 matches against Showa ITO (Shuei, Sen), 7-2-1
sen.cmt: Ten→10 と修正しました。コロンを補いました。with→against と修正しました。
sen.e: 1870: 10 matches against Showa ITO (Shuei, Sen), 7-2-1

sen.j: 1876年 中川亀三郎十番碁（秀栄先）
sen.e: 1876 Ten matches with Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA (Shuei, Sen)
1876: 10 matches against Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA (Shuei, Sen)
sen.cmt: Ten→10 と修正しました。コロンを補いました。 with→against と修正しました。
sen.e: 1876: 10 matches against Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA (Shuei, Sen)

sen.j: 1876年 藤田方策十番碁（互先、4連勝で藤田先相先）
sen.e: 1876 Ten matches with Hosaku FUJITA (Tagai-sen [no handicap], 4 consecutive wins, Fujita, Sen ai sen [first move in two matches and second move in one match])
1876: 10 matches against Hosaku FUJITA (Tagai-sen [no handicap], 4 consecutive wins, Fujita, Sen ai sen [1st move in 2 matches and 2nd move in 1 match])
sen.cmt: Ten→10 と修正しました。コロンを補いました。 with→against と修正しました。first→1st,two→2,second→2nd,one→1 と修正しました。
sen.e: 1876: 10 matches against Hosaku FUJITA (Tagai-sen [no handicap], 4 consecutive wins, Fujita, Sen ai sen [1st move in 2 matches and 2nd move in 1 match])

sen.j: 1876-77年 小林鉄次郎二十番碁（互先、9局目まで6-2-1で小林先相先、18局まで7-2-1で小林定先）13-5-2
sen.e: 1876 to 1877 Twenty matches with Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI (Tagai-sen, 6-2-1 up to the ninth match, Kobayashi, Sen ai sen, 7-2-1 up to the eighteenth match, Kobayashi, Josen), 13-5-2
1876 to 1877: 20 matches against Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI (Tagai-sen, 6-2-1 up to the 9th match, Kobayashi, Sen ai sen, 7-2-1 up to the 18th match, Kobayashi, Josen), 13-5-2
sen.cmt: コロンを補いました。Twenty→20,with→against,ninth→9th,eighteenth→18th と修正しました。
sen.e: 1876 to 1877: 20 matches against Tetsujiro KOBAYASHI (Tagai-sen, 6-2-1 up to the 9th match, Kobayashi, Sen ai sen, 7-2-1 up to the 18th match, Kobayashi, Josen), 13-5-2

sen.j: 1877年 黒田俊節十番碁（互先）4-6
sen.e: 1877 Ten matches with Shunsetsu KURODA (Tagai-sen) 4-6
1877: 10 matches against Shunsetsu KURODA (Tagai-sen) 4-6
sen.cmt: コロンを補いました。 Ten→10,with→against と修正しました。
sen.e: 1877: 10 matches against Shunsetsu KURODA (Tagai-sen) 4-6

sen.j: 1884-86年 村瀬秀甫十番碁（秀栄先）5-5
sen.e: 1884 to 1886 Ten matches with Shuho MURASE (Shuei, Sen), 5-5
1884 to 1886: 10 matches against Shuho MURASE (Shuei, Sen), 5-5
sen.cmt: コロンを補いました。 Ten→10,with→against と修正しました。
sen.e: 1884 to 1886: 10 matches against Shuho MURASE (Shuei, Sen), 5-5

sen.j: 1896年 石井千治十番碁（石井先）8-2
sen.e: 1896 Ten matches with Senji ISHII (Ishii, Sen), 8-2
1896: 10 matches against Senji ISHII (Ishii, Sen), 8-2
sen.cmt: コロンを補いました。 Ten→10,with→against と修正しました。

sen.j: 1897年 安井算英十番碁（算英先相先）6-4
sen.e: 1897 Ten matches with Sanei YASUI (Sanei, Sen ai sen), 6-4
1897: 10 matches against Sanei YASUI (Sanei, Sen ai sen), 6-4
sen.cmt: コロンを補いました。 Ten→10,with→against と修正しました。
sen.e: 1897: 10 matches against Sanei YASUI (Sanei, Sen ai sen), 6-4

sen.j: 1898年 第2次安井算英十番碁（算英先、4局目まで4-0で先二先）8-2
sen.e: 1898 The second ten matches with Sanei YASUI (Sanei, Sen, 4-0 up to the fourth match, Sen ni sen [first move in two matches and a two-stone-handicap in one match]), 8-2
1898: The 2nd 10 matches against Sanei YASUI (Sanei, Sen, 4-0 up to the 4th match, Sen ni sen [1st move in 2 matches and a two-stone-handicap in 1 match]), 8-2

sen.j: 1900年 雁金準一十番碁（雁金二先二）
sen.e: 1900 Ten matches with Junichi KARIGANE (Karigane, Ni Sen ni [first move in one match and a two-stone-handicap in two matches])
1900: 10 matches against Junichi KARIGANE (Karigane, Ni Sen ni [1st move in 1 match and a two-stone-handicap in 2 matches])
sen.cmt: コロンを補いました。 Ten→10,with→against,first→1st,one→1,two→2 と修正しました。
sen.e: 1900: 10 matches against Junichi KARIGANE (Karigane, Ni Sen ni [1st move in 1 match and a two-stone-handicap in 2 matches])

sen.j: その他、方円社との分離後は、囲碁奨励会、四象会にて対局が行われた。
sen.e: Other than the above, Igo matches were held in Igo Shorei Kai and Shishokai after separating from Hoensha.
Other than the above, Igo matches were held in Igo Shorei Kai and Shishokai after separating from Hoensha.
Other than the above, Igo matches were held in Igo Shorei Kai and Shishokai after separating from Hoensha.

sen.j: 棋風・人物
sen.e: Igo style and personality of Shuei
Igo style and Personal profile
sen.cmt: personality of Shuei→Personal profile と修正しました。
sen.e: Igo style and Personal profile

sen.j: 早見え早打ちであったとされる。
sen.e: It has been said that Shuei was quick to understand and quick to place Igo stones.
It has been said that Shuei was quick to see and quick to place Igo stones.
It has been said that Shuei was quick to see and quick to place Igo stones.

sen.j: 昭和になって本因坊秀哉は「秀栄先生には、今でも先相先は打たれるでしょう」と語った。
sen.e: After 1926, Honinbo Shusai told that 'even now Master Shuei would beat me even if I played Sen ai sen'.
After 1926, Honinbo Shusai told that 'even now Master Shuei would beat me even if I played Sen ai sen.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: After 1926, Honinbo Shusai told that 'even now Master Shuei would beat me even if I played Sen ai sen.'

sen.j: 政治家では犬養毅、大久保利通と親しかったことが、『犬養木堂伝』に記されている。
sen.e: "Bokudo INUKAI Den" (biography of Bokudo INUKAI) described that Shuei was a close friend of the politicians including Tsuyoshi INUKAI and Toshimichi OKUBO.
"Inukai Bokudo den" (biography of Bokudo INUKAI) describes that Shuei was a close friend of those politicians including Tsuyoshi INUKAI and Toshimichi OKUBO.
sen.cmt: Bokudo INUKAI Den→Inukai Bokudo den （この本はこう表記されているものが多いのでこのように修正しました）,described→describes,the→those と修正しました。
sen.e: "Inukai Bokudo den" (biography of Bokudo INUKAI) describes that Shuei was a close friend of those politicians including Tsuyoshi INUKAI and Toshimichi OKUBO.

sen.j: 朝鮮から日本に亡命していた金玉均とは交友が深く、金が小笠原諸島や北海道に流された際にもその地を訪ねて慰めた。
sen.e: Shuei was close to Gyokukin KIN, who fled from Korea to Japan, and visited to console when Kin was exiled to the Ogasawara Islands and Hokkaido.
Shuei was close to Gyokukin KIN, who had fled from Korea to Japan, and visited to console him when Kin was exiled to the Ogasawara Islands and Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: fled→had fled と修正しました。him を補いました。
sen.e: Shuei was close to Gyokukin KIN, who had fled from Korea to Japan, and visited to console him when Kin was exiled to the Ogasawara Islands and Hokkaido.

sen.j: 田村保寿が秀栄門下となったのも金の口添えによる。
sen.e: It was Kin who advised Yasuhisa TAMURA to become a disciple of Shuei.
It was Kin who advised Yasuhisa TAMURA to become a disciple of Shuei.
It was Kin who advised Yasuhisa TAMURA to become a disciple of Shuei.

sen.j: 四象会などにおいて高田民子に大きな援助を受けていたが、代稽古に遣っていた門下の野沢竹朝の不作法を咎められたことで高田家と縁を切り、四象会運営は苦しくなった。
sen.e: He was considerably supported by Tamiko TAKADA for Shishokai and others, but disconnected from the Takada family due to the improper manners of Chikucho NOZAWA, his disciple who trained other disciples as his proxy, and therefore the management of Shishokai was in trouble.

He was considerably supported by Tamiko TAKADA for Shishokai and others, but disconnected from the Takada family due to the improper manners of Chikucho NOZAWA, his disciple who trained other disciples as his proxy, and therefore the management of Shishokai came in trouble.

He was considerably supported by Tamiko TAKADA for Shishokai and others, but disconnected from the Takada family due to the improper manners of Chikucho NOZAWA, his disciple who trained other disciples as his proxy, and therefore the management of Shishokai came in trouble.

sen.j: しかしこの後の日本囲棋会設立においても高田民子は会員となった。
sen.e: However, Tamiko TAKADA became a member even when the Nihon Igo Kai was established.
However, Tamiko TAKADA became a member again when the Nihon Igo Kai was established.
However, Tamiko TAKADA became a member again when the Nihon Igo Kai was established.

sen.j: 有名局
sen.e: Famous Igo match
Famous match
Famous match

sen.j: 1895年、田村保寿四段（先二の先番）との一局。
sen.e: The match with Yasuhisa TAMURA the fourth dan level (with a handicap of the first move) in 1895
The match against Yasuhisa TAMURA the fourth dan level (with a handicap of the first move) in 1895
sen.cmt: with→against と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: The match against Yasuhisa TAMURA the fourth dan level (with a handicap of the first move) in 1895

sen.j: 左辺5子のサバキを問われた場面、白1のハネ (囲碁)から白3と取られている2子を3子にしたのが語り伝えられる秀栄の妙手。
sen.e: In the scene (see the figure) when Shuei was challenged how to handle five stones in the left side, his excellent move has been passed down that he made the third white, and two stones taken by the opponent, to three stones from Hane (putting a stone crossly) of the first white.

In the scene (see the figure) when Shuei was challenged how to handle five stones in the left side, his spectacular move has been passed down that he made the third white, and two stones taken by the opponent, to three stones from Hane (putting a stone crossly) of the first white.

In the scene (see the figure) when Shuei was challenged how to handle five stones in the left side, his spectacular move has been passed down that he made the third white, and two stones taken by the opponent, to three stones from Hane (putting a stone crossly) of the first white.

sen.j: aの受けならbとノゾキを利かしてdとハネ、種石の黒3子を取り込む。
sen.e: He took in 'd' and Hane, also three black stones which were pivotal (should not be taken in) by utilizing 'b' and Nozoki (approaching) for receiving 'a'.
He took in 'd' and Hane, also three black stones which were pivotal (should not be taken in) by utilizing 'b' and Nozoki (approaching) for receiving 'a.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: He took in 'd' and Hane, also three black stones which were pivotal (should not be taken in) by utilizing 'b' and Nozoki (approaching) for receiving 'a.'

sen.j: また白3に対してcのツギなら、白e、黒a、白f、黒g、白hとワタリ (囲碁)しまう。
sen.e: Moreover, for Tsugi (connecting not to be connected) of 'c' towards the third white, he performed Watari (connecting own stones) for the white 'e', black 'a', white 'f', black 'g', and white 'h'.
Moreover, for Tsugi (connecting not to be cut) of 'c' towards the third white, he performed Watari (connecting own stones) for the white 'e,' black 'a,' white 'f,' black 'g,' and white 'h.'
sen.cmt: connected→cut,カンマの位置、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Moreover, for Tsugi (connecting not to be cut) of 'c' towards the third white, he performed Watari (connecting own stones) for the white 'e,' black 'a,' white 'f,' black 'g,' and white 'h.'

sen.j: 黒の田村はeとアテて上の3子を捨てる他なく、ピンチの白5子は大威張りで生還することとなった。
sen.e: Tamura of the black stones had to perform Ate (doing above Watari) with 'e' and throw away upper three stones, and white five stones which were in a pinch could proudly return.
Tamura of the black stones had to perform Ate (doing above Watari) with 'e' and throw away upper three stones, and white five stones which were in a trouble could proudly return.
Tamura of the black stones had to perform Ate (doing above Watari) with 'e' and throw away upper three stones, and white five stones which were in a trouble could proudly return.

sen.j: 囲碁史上に残る妙手として有名だが、ここに至るまでの秀栄の打ち回しにも評価が高い。
sen.e: This excellent move is quite famous in Igo history and also Shuei's playing style up to there was also highly evaluated.
This spectacular move is famous in Igo history and also Shuei's playing style up to there was also highly evaluated.
sen.cmt: excellent→spectacular と修正しました。quite を削除しました。
sen.e: This spectacular move is famous in Igo history and also Shuei's playing style up to there was also highly evaluated.

sen.e: Books and Publication
Books and Publications
Books and Publications

"Setting Moves in Igo, New Technique of Igo," Okura Shoten (publisher), 1894 (Shuei's instruction manual for Fuseki [preparation] from Nine stones to Tagai-sen)

sen.j: 『囲棋奨励雑誌』囲碁奨励会 1892年-不明（囲碁奨励会の対局譜を掲載）

"Igo Shorei Zasshi" (encouragement magazine), Igo Shorei Kai, 1892 - Unknown (published the Igo matches of Igo Shorei Kai)
"Igo Shorei Zasshi" (encouragement magazine), Igo Shorei Kai, 1892 - Unknown (published the Igo matches of Igo Shorei Kai)

sen.j: 名人秀栄棋譜保存会『秀栄全集』大野万歳館 1911年（棋譜256局を収録、編集主任本因坊秀哉、1922年再版）

Master Shuei Kifu (record of Igo matches) Preservation Society, "Complete Works of Shuei," Ono Banzai Kan (publisher), 1911 (recorded 256 Igo matches, chief editor Honinbo Shuei, reprinted in 1922)
